subject: Re: [junit] Re: How do I submit code which I think should be adde d to  JUnit?
msgSnippet: ... I disagree. As for JUnit I m wearing the customer s hat not the developer s one. So what I want is a tool that does not more and not less than what I need.
messageBody:
"Brekke, Jeff" wrote:
>
> If we 'eat our own dog food' and follow the practices that JUnit
> is used to promote, than change should not be feared.
>

I disagree. As for JUnit I'm wearing the customer's hat not the
developer's one. So what I want is a tool that does not more and not
less than what I need. If I have to carry around too much baggage I
don't need I'm going to look for another tool. Of course, there are many
JUnit "customers" and there are many views on what is needed. My view
is: less is more.

Johannes
